title: Tapas
subtitle: Tapas — The Spirit of Spain
description: The tapas tradition is the delightful Spanish custom of gathering at ‘Tascas’ (watering holes providing food) for a glass of sherry, wine or beer and sampling a range of different dishes amongst friends. Tapas is fun and informal. Here at Barceloneta we also provide racions (larger portion dishes), both in the menu and on our regularly changing Special Boards. As well as Spain, our food is influenced from other regions of the Mediterranean and of the wider Latin world. So, grab yourself a drink, order your dishes and away you go. (If you have never tried this style before don’t be afraid to ask us for some suggestions, on drinks as well as food.) "Buen Apetito"
disclaimer: Food allergies and intolerances: Full allergen information on the ingredients in the food we serve is available upon request. Dishes may vary from those shown due to seasonal availability of ingredients. Fish, poultry and shellfish dishes may contain bones and/or shell. Please be aware that all our dishes are prepared in a kitchen where nuts and gluten are present, as well as other allergens, therefore we cannot guarantee that any food item is completely ‘free from’ traces of allergens, due to the risk of cross contamination. Our food is cooked using vegetable oil. Please note for tables of 4 or more we will add a 10% discretionary service charge to your bill.
note: All of our meat is supplied by award winning producer Owen Taylor. All of our Spanish produce is sourced directly from Spain.

title: Party Menu
subtitle: Mon–Sat • £24.95 per person (Choose any six dishes for everyone in your party)
description:
For larger parties — in order to give you and your guests the level of service you deserve, we provide this keenly priced menu, which includes our most popular dishes. On very busy nights, for tables of 8 or more, it may be the only way we can accommodate you. As always please talk to us.

For re-fills from the party menu, À La Carte charges will be applicable per dish.

⚠️ A supplement charge of £5.00 per guest will be added for Paella Mixta (Seafood Paella).

items.name: Marqués Alfamen Rosado
items.description: Garnacha — Spain. Pure light fresh Rosé, dry whilst being peachy on the nose. Food pairing: Blue cheese, spicy tapas

items.name: Medievo Rioja Rosado
items.description: Spain. Pale rosé colour with floral summer fruit aromas, dry with plenty of refreshing acidity. Food pairing: Blue cheese, spicy tapas

items.name: Marqués Alfamen Chardonnay
items.description: Macabeo — Spain. Fresh aromatic white wine with juicy melon and pineapple fruit. Food pairing: Chicken or shellfish

items.name: Finca de Oro Blanco
items.description: Spain. Fresh, clean and youthful with apple and pear drop aromas. Food pairing: Perfect with white fish dishes

items.name: Joaquin Rebolledo Godello
items.description: Spain. Rich ripe aromas of melon and greengage followed by a dry succulent palate. Food pairing: White meat and seafood dishes

items.name: Valdecea Albariño
items.description: Spain. Lovely floral and exotic fruit aromas with a zingy fresh dry taste. Food pairing: Seafood, paella

items.name: Marqués Alfamen (Red)
items.description: Garnacha/Syrah — Spain. Juicy mid-bodied red wine packed with dark berry fruits. Food pairing: Paella or cheese

items.name: Finca de Oro Rioja
items.description: Spain. Refined and complex mid-bodied red wine showing dark fruit spice and oaky aromas. Food pairing: Pork or Manchego

items.name: Piqueras OVG
items.description: Spain. Dry fuller-bodied and deeply coloured with sweet perfumed raspberry fruits, confected plum, vanilla, clove, toast and dried fruits. Food pairing: Grilled pork

items.name: Medievo Crianza
items.description: Spain. Concentrated red wine with solid tannin structure and mid-full body. Food pairing: Beef or pork

items.name: Paternina Cava Brut
items.description: Spain. Clean aged aromas with floral hints, balanced and long lasting clean aftertaste. Food pairing: Seafood, poultry, dessert

items.name: Paternina Cava Rosado
items.description: Spain. Pink salmon in colour with fruity aromas, fresh red fruits with touches of butter & bread. Food pairing: Seafood or white meats

title: Fino & Sherry Selection
subtitle: Fino (50ml | 375ml Bottle) • Sherry (50ml) — A perfect compliment to food

items.name: Apostoles Palo Cortado PX
items.description: ABV 20% — Palomino and PX grapes fermented separately and aged 12 years in soleras before blending, then 18 years together. Medium dry on the palate with fig, raisin, caramel, vanilla and walnut

items.name: Matusalem Oloroso / PX
items.description: ABV 20.5% — Oloroso and PX spend 15 years in their own soleras, then 15 more years blended. Beautifully sweet Oloroso with profound dried fruit and spice flavours. Perfect with cheese or dessert

items.name: Manzanilla
items.description: ABV 15% — Pale straw colour, clean intense aromas of fruit and cut grass. Dry yet soft with classic salty notes and refreshing bitterness on the finish

items.name: Oloroso
items.description: ABV 17.5% — Deep and rich with aromas of orange peel, almonds and hazelnuts. Dry and powerful on the palate with a vibrant, crisp finish

items.name: Pedro Ximenez
items.description: ABV 15% — Sweet, silky and unctuous wine with aromas of honey, raisin, figs and dates. Toasted notes of coffee, chocolate and liquorice

items.name: Baileys Coffee
items.description: Liqueur Coffee

items.name: Irish Coffee
items.description: Liqueur Coffee
